pymice.exploration module¶

Here some text and contents with links to the modules below.

pymice.exploration.md_patterns module¶

Some title

class pymice.exploration.md_patterns.mdPatterns¶

Bases: object

some comments Initialize with nothing, then run get_patterns

Parameters

  • incomplete_data – Matrix with shape (n, m). Dataset with missing values

  • missing_values – The placeholder for the missing values as needed by MissingIndicator

get_patterns()¶

Examples

X = np.random.randn(100, 3) mask1 = np.random.binomial(n=1, size=X.shape[0], p=0.5) mask2 = np.random.binomial(n=1, size=X.shape[0], p=0.5) X[mask1==1, 0] = np.nan X[mask2==1, 1] = np.nan mypat = mp.mdPatterns() mdpatterns = mypat.get_patterns(X)

get_patterns(X, show_plot=True, show_patterns=True)¶

Some comments

Parameters

X (Matrix) – Matrix of shape (n_samples, m_features) Incomplete input data, where “n_samples” is the number of samples and “m_features” is the number of features.

Return type

Union[DataFrame, ndarray]

Returns

  • md_patterns

  • plot_md_patterns (when show_plot is True)

pymice.exploration.mcar_statistical_tests module¶

Some title

class pymice.exploration.mcar_statistical_tests.McarTest(method='littles')¶

Bases: object

static littles_mcar_test(data)¶

Implementation of Little’s MCAR test Returns the p_value, the outcome of a chi-square statistical test. Null hypothesis: “missingness mech of data is MCAR”.

Return type

float

static mcar_t_tests(data)¶

MCAR t-tests for each pair of variables.

Returns a matrix of p-values for each pair of variables. Null hypothesis: missingness in row variable is MCAR vs col variable.

Return type

Union[DataFrame, ndarray]
